AttributeError: module 'torch' has no attribute 'get_default_device'
ChatGPT said:

Thought for 13 seconds
Why it‚Äôs failing
NumPy 2.x vs. PyTorch 2.1.2
PyTorch 2.1.2 was compiled against NumPy 1.x. When you start Python with NumPy 2.2.6 already imported, PyTorch prints the

A module that was compiled using NumPy 1.x cannot be run in NumPy 2.x ‚Ä¶
warning and then some internal look-ups fail.

Transformers ‚â• 4.39 expects torch>=2.2.0
The latest transformers tries to call torch.get_default_device() (added in torch 2.2).
Because you have torch 2.1.2, that attribute does not exist ‚Üí AttributeError.

So you have an incompatible trio:

Package	Installed	Required for smooth run
numpy	2.2.6	< 2.0 (e.g., 1.26.4)
torch	2.1.2	‚â• 2.2.0 (or downgrade transformers)
transformers	latest	Works with torch ‚â• 2.2
üöÄ Two clean solutions
Option A ‚Äî Upgrade PyTorch & downgrade NumPy (recommended)
Works offline after first download; easiest path forward.

# inside your review_assistant_env
pip uninstall torch -y
pip uninstall numpy -y

# 1Ô∏è‚É£  install numpy 1.26.x  (latest 1.x branch)
pip install "numpy<2.0,>=1.26.4"

# 2Ô∏è‚É£  install CPU-only PyTorch 2.2.2  (wheel link from PyTorch)
pip install torch==2.2.2+cpu -f https://download.pytorch.org/whl/torch_stable.html
Now verify:

python - <<'PY'
import torch, numpy, transformers
print("torch", torch.__version__)
print("numpy", numpy.__version__)
print("transformers", transformers.__version__)
from transformers import pipeline
print("‚Ä¶ initialising summarizer")
print(pipeline("summarization", model="t5-small"))
